qas.question: What percentage of Plymouth's population call themselves Christian?
What percentage of Plymouth residents follow Islam?
What percentage of Plymouth consists of non-religious people?
What percentage of people in the United Kingdom describe themselves as non-religious?
What was the percentage decline in Jewish residents of Plymouth between 2001 and 2011?

context: <a0_0>58.1%<a0_0/> of the population described themselves in the 2011 census return as being at least nominally Christian and <a1_0>0.8%<a1_0/> as Muslim with all other religions represented by less than 0.5% each. The portion of people without a religion is <a2_0>32.9%<a2_0/>; above the national average of <a3_0>24.<a4_0>7%<a4_0/><a3_0/>. 7.1% did not state their religious belief. Since the 2001 Census, the number of Christians and Jews has decreased (-16% and -7% respectively), while all other religions have increased and non-religious people have almost doubled in number.
